p: Dry conditions can increase nitrate levels in corn plants and encourage the accumulation of nitrogen dioxide (NO 2), thereby elevating the risk of “silo-filler’s disease” [ 158]. A greater number of “silo-filler’s disease” cases were reported in New York State after a dry growing season in 1995 [ 158]. There are approximately five cases of silo-filler’s disease per 100,000 silo-associated farm workers in New York State annually [ 159].
